intro: Pentacalia suboppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests.
